title: Honor in Clash
body: As an honor 0 player and someone that has been waiting for clash to come out I'm fairly disappointed that Honor 2 and below are not able to participate, I'm a mid plat player and was looking forward to playing a competitive game against (Somewhat) good players, This is just gonna encourage me to play on one of my smurf accounts that is low silver and ruin the experience for other players just for me to be able to experience clash which is not only gonna be boring for me but also for the people I will be playing against as I'd most likely be on a team with my friends with High plat - mid diamond main accounts all on bronze/silver accounts since they're mostly all honor 0, I doubt im the only one in this situation as I know that plat and above is extremly toxic and for these players not to be able to participate in clash would be really disheartening, Im completly fine with not receiving rewards but the fact that I outrite cant participate is a bit, eh.

replies.body:
Yea i dont see the point in an honor level restriction ... you are playing with your own friends so they have to put up with you not strangers and honor is ment to be hidden.

bit of strong league bias on this one imho.

the point of honor restriction is to not reward Honorable players. it's the same reason you don't get keys or chests below honor lvl 1 and end of season rewards below honor level 2

and if you want to play and not get rewards that is also just taking away spots from other players

> and if you want to play and not get rewards that is also just taking away spots from other players

This is my main issue with the "complaints" in this thread. It's not fair on the positive/neutral players to have spots taken away from them just because the "negative" players want to participate in Clash.

The issue could be solved with some changes to how the Clash system works, by having two distinct Clash "modes", one which is restricted to Honour 2+ and gives rewards, and another that is open to everyone that gives no rewards. That way, people participate in the "mode" they choose, and no one has spots "taken away" from them. Personally, I would have no issues with such a system.

*However*, as far as the currently implemented version of Clash, it does make sense to restrict it, as it acts as both a deterrent for negative behaviour, and a reward for positive behaviour.

I agree, I'm gonna be forced to play on a smurf account just to play clash as leveling honor up to level 2 on my main account is going to take way too long as I've already been reset twice to honor 0 so I've basically given up on trying to get it and will just play clash on a smurf account seeing as thats my only logical answer
Was interested in the idea; however, I have friend who like to give others 'strong advice' when in games sometimes.  So yea pass on this one cos  cant play with my friends.
